title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: HHS demands Massachusetts remove 'gender ideology' from sex ed materials or face losing $2.36 million in federal funding.
Massachusetts, among 46 states, was given a 60-day deadline to revise Personal Responsibility Education Program materials.
Production timeline and who’s attached are inside.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão was appointed Boston Legacy FC's inaugural head coach after leading Benfica's women to five consecutive league titles.
Patão expressed excitement about Boston's sports culture, noting similarities with her values and ambitions for the new club.
Indulge in Filipa Patão's favorite new local taste—the lobster roll—as she settles into Boston's vibrant sports scene.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Boston Bruins on October 6, 2024.
Swayman ranked 63rd out of 73 goalies in goals saved above expected in the 2024-25 NHL season.
Catch Swayman's transformation as the Bruins' top goalie at Warrior Ice Arena this training camp.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels prepares to face the Raiders in Sunday's home opener at Gillette Stadium.
McDaniels reflects on his time with the Raiders, where he posted a 9-16 record.
Spot young talent like Will Campbell as the Patriots face the Raiders for the season opener.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks, a Pittsfield native, will star in and produce Prime Video's series about Karen Read's murder case.
48% of readers in a Boston.com poll support Banks' casting, with 38% suggesting alternatives like Anne Hathaway.
Consider the local opinions on this controversial casting decision and role portrayal in a high-profile project.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville ranked No. 2 among non-Vegas casinos in USA Today's 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.
Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket secured the third position on the list, offering extensive dining and gaming options.
Visit Mohegan Sun for unique gaming experiences like traditional Asian table games in the Casino of the Earth.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún, a two-day Irish music festival, will take place at Suffolk Downs this weekend with headliners Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues.
One-day tickets are priced at $75 for GA lawn, $100 for GA pit, and $257 for Turf Club VIP seating.
Don't miss the first U.S. appearance by The Pogues in over 20 years at Seisiún this Sunday.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen staff accuse leadership of fostering a toxic workplace, highlighting issues such as insensitive remarks and workplace disparities.
Jen Faigel and CWK board acknowledge challenges, citing the nonprofit's struggles and their ongoing efforts in supporting entrepreneurship.
Read CommonWealth Kitchen’s key line in context.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions advance; 3 fail. Initiatives include rent control and tax changes, says Attorney General Campbell.
Proponents need 74,574 signatures by Dec. 3 for ballot eligibility. Legislature decides on proposals by May 6, or more signatures needed.
Don't overlook the rent control proposal limiting increases to the lower of CPI or 5%, exempting small owner-occupied buildings.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Senator Thom Tillis questioned RFK Jr.'s stance on Operation Warp Speed during a contentious Senate hearing.
RFK Jr. faced calls for dismissal after replacing a vaccine advisory panel with skeptics, sparking public health concern.
Dive into the implications of RFK Jr.'s shifting COVID-19 vaccine policies on public health strategies.
